metadata.title: CVE-2015-6826 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The ff_rv34_decode_init_thread_copy function in libavcodec/rv34.c in FFmpegbefore 2.7.2 does not initialize certain structure members, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid pointer access) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted (1) RV30 or (2) RV40RealVideo data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
